description: Price Reduced for Immediate Sale, Liveaboard Potential, Priced to sell. Brand new Cruisair 16K BTU reverse cycle marine air Heat and A/C unit w/digital controller installed. New Bimini Top for Fly-bridge, Old top and enclosure for fly-bridge still present.  Upholstery around the cock-pit just finished and installed. Single V-berth forward opens to a spacious galley on the port side and a large bathroom with full-sized shower on the starboard side. Aft is a comfortable salon with couch/sleeper and convertible dinette/sleeper. Entertainment provided by a TV and VCR with powered TV antenna, Kenwood 6 disc CD changer w/ AM/FM radio with digital display and remote control, and marine-speakers throughout the boat.  The salon opens to the aft deck through a sliding glass door. Outside you will find the aft deck with access to the swim platform as well as the bridge with comfortable seating for up to 11 people and a fold away wet-bar. This Fly-bridge has a freshwater sink, an Ice-maker/cooler, marine-speakers for entertainment, and a 110V power outlet for aux power. The bridge also has a hatch with a ladder down into the salon. This boat is operational and very well maintained. Cruises at 22 knots+. She is a great Liveaboard, weekender, or extended cruiser, even sport fisher. Recently hauled out for bottom inspection, painting of bottom and running gear, and new zincs. Improvements continue, enclosure needs to be replaced. LOA: 37' Engines: Twin MerCruiser 350 MAG MPI, Raw water cooled Total HP: 600 Fuel: Gas Generator: Kohler 6.5Kw Shore Power: Twin 30 Amp Engine hours 3/3/16: Port: 614 Starboard: 587 Genset: 394

description: This boat features 2 Perkins Diesel engines, 130HP each, controlled by upper and lower helms, spacious upper flybridge and lower back deck. Enter two aft wooden doors to a large galley and salon with the lower helm on the starboard side. Forward you step down into two staterooms, a full V-Berth and the second stateroom with a long bunk along the port side. The staterooms share a common full-sized head with shower. This vessel has 2 functional reverse cycle marine heat and air units with digital controls, pressurized fresh water system with holding tank, hot water heater, refrigerator, propane stove with oven, vac-u-flush head with holding tank and pump-out, and many more amenities. Beautiful Cruiser or extended stay boat. Currently hauled out and stored on land for winter storage, has also been winterized for the season. Previously docked under a covered slip in Colonial Beach, VA. Most of the wood has recently been re-finished. Motors run well and boat operates as it should. Electronics work but are also dated. This boat does need some cosmetic re-finishing. The old canvas is still present but it is quite old and in bad shape, all bimini bars are still in place. This boat does not have a generator but there is room for one. The decks could use a fresh coat of non-skid. Most windows could use re-sealing. The instrument panel has a total hours gauge showing 1136 Total hours. This boat is being sold AS-IS, WHERE-IS. Owner may be able to assist with transportation of vessel, unable to owner-finance. Owner may be able to assist with any modifications or upgrades to vessel. NO TRADES ACCEPTED OR CONSIDERED. MOTIVATED TO SELL, ALL SERIOUS OFFERS CONSIDERED!!!! EMAIL WITH ANY QUESTIONS OR TO SEE IN PERSON!!!!

description: Can show certain weekends and weekdays.  Selling for a friend, the original owner. Make offer.  Enthusiast websites value this condition rare boat around $20,000.  Looking only for an upper four digit offer. This collectible boat is a 1950 Model.  It was built in June 1949.  It has been in the same family since fall of 1949. It has never been in salt water. The boat has all original parts  as when purchased (excepting new stainless steel propeller shaft installed 1997, and a new spare propeller) . All chrome fittings were re-chromed in 1996.  There are no known problems with the hull's structure.  The membrane in the double bottom has deteriorated,  seams have been caulked with oakum and flexible caulk, this needs annual maintenance.  A bilge pump has been installed.  The engine, a six cylinder 95 Hp Continental adapted for ChrisCraft was rebuilt in 1996 by a New Haven, Ct. company specializing in marine engine repair..  There is no log, but time on engine is est. to be less than 300 hours.  All hardware was re-chromed in 1996. People specializing in classic boat  will judge the condition of the boat as good. It needs new varnish and floor covering. Included is original trailer supplied by ChrisCraft.  Needs painting. Last time in water was Nov. 2015,  Engine was running in Nov. 2015 when it was winterized. Could not be started this spring due to old gas. Fuel pump has been  removed and checked out good.  It has to be installed and old gas removed.  It can be started on trailer and run for a few seconds.  It should not be put in water until hull is soaked, which takes about 3 to 4 days.
